title: 1970–71 European Cup
text:
The 1970–71 season of the <a href="UEFA%20Champions%20League">European Cup</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> club tournament was won by <a href="AFC%20Ajax">Ajax</a> in the final against <a href="Panathinaikos%20F.C.">Panathinaikos</a>. It was the first time the cup went to Ajax, beginning a three-year period of domination, and the second consecutive championship for Netherlands. <a href="UEFA">UEFA</a> had introduced for first time the <a href="Penalty%20shoot-out%20%28association%20football%29">penalty shoot-out</a> as a way of deciding drawn ties – doing away with the unsatisfactory <a href="Coin%20flipping%23Use%20in%20dispute%20resolution">tossing of a coin</a>. They had also decided that the away goals rule should apply to all rounds, and not just the first two, as had been the case.
<a href="Feyenoord">Feyenoord</a>, the defending champions, were eliminated by Romanian club <a href="FC%20UTA%20Arad">UTA Arad</a> in the first round.
This season marked the first time in European Cup history that <a href="Real%20Madrid%20C.F.">Real Madrid</a> failed to qualify for the tournament, having appeared in all 15 previous seasons. It was also the first time a Greek team reached the final.
